flawed_nl_solution:
If she changes the box weekly, then in 210 days, she will change the box 210/7=<<210/7=30>>30 times.
At 15 pounds of litter for every box change, she will require 30*15=<<30*15=540>>540 pounds of cat litter in 210 days.
If she buys 45-pound containers, then for 540 pounds she will need to buy 540/45=<<540/45=12>>12 containers of litter.
At $21 per container, to buy enough cat litter for 210 days, it will cost 12 * $21 = $252

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 450.0, not 540.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
